Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2014 08:33PM Deanna504 wrote: I have a core needle biopsy scheduled for Tuesday. I can do nothing BUT worry!  Mine is a RAD 4. Only 7 mm, irregular, solid mass. The waiting is horrible. I'm having nightmares every night. I'm certainly imagining the worst!  I'm 42. My mom died of breast cancer at 46.
Posts.Title: BI-RADS 5 rita22 Miah-xx

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2014 10:34PM Deanna504 wrote: I am hopeful now. Biopsy on Tuesday. Was keeping track through your initial post, and was saddened to see you ended up on this board. Just wanted to say that I'm so sorry about your news. I'm not sure how I would/will do it!  I'm already so angry!  There are so many advances in cancer care. Things are getting better every day. Wishing you love and wellness!
Posts.Title: The news isn't good Hopeful82014 Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: Deanna504 wrote: Post a reply 2 hours ago Deanna504 wrote: hi! I'm 41. My mom died at 46 of BC. My maternal greataunt died at 36 of Non Hodgkin's lymphoma. I found a tiny lump, very near my chest/sternum/breast margin. Finally went to gyno, who sent me for mammogram. I sat there after, and they were like "the doctor would like to see you." So, the doc did an ultrasound. The lump was very visible. Looked oval on the screen. I was thinking cyst. The doc says they'll have to do a biopsy. It will be a core needle biopsy, this Tuesday. I'm scared to death! Ultrasound report says,  " there is an irregular, solid mass measuring 7mm seen in the posterior 3 o'clock region of the right breast. Findings correlate to the palpable abnormality in the posterior region of the r breast at 3'o clock. This could be a dermal finding, but I could not confirm that it is in the skin. BI RADS Catergory 4: suspicious abnormality." Does anyone know the significance of "dermal finding"? And how does the report look to you, as far as possibility that it's malignant vs benign? I'm out of my mind scared!! Edit Delete Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dermal finding? Deanna504 bevin
